SvPreferenceAttr.label: Setting Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the name of the e-mail settings used to specify e-mail targets when adding alerts.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Driver
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the driver used to connect to the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Password
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the password used to connect to the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Connection URL
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the URL to the database connection (for example, if the ODBC connection is called, the URL would be jdbc:odbc:).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Username
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the username used to connect to the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Configuration Update Frequency
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the configuration update frequency in seconds.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Initialize database from current configuration files
SvPreferenceAttr.description: If you would like the database initialized with the current contents of the configuration files, check this box. Warning: checking this box will delete the current configurations stored in the database for this server - we advise using this feature only when initially setting up database configuration.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Community
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the community variable for the SNMP MIB. The default is public.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Connection URL
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the URL to the database connection (for example, jdbc:inetdae:myserver.mycompany.com:1433?database=master).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Connection Timeout
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the connection timeout (in seconds) to use for the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Driver
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the driver used to connect to the database (for example, com.inet.tds.TdsDriver)

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Password
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the password used to connect to the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Query Timeout
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the query timeout (in seconds) to use for the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SQL Query
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the SQL query to run against a table in the database that returns the list of IP addresses to be monitored.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Username
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the username for connecting to the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Exclude IP
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter IP addresses to be excluded from the Update Set, for example, the default gateway IP. To exclude multiple IP address, separate them by commas.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Update Frequency
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the frequency (in seconds) that SiteView will query the MIB or database for new nodes and create monitor sets for new nodes.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Group Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter a name for the group to be created to contain all subgroups created using the template selected above.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Monitor Set Subgroup Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the monitor group name to be assigned to each set of monitors created using the above template. Default is IP address. Enter an optional text string to be appended to default name.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Server Address
SvPreferenceAttr.description: The server or console where the SNMP MIB is found. Enter the UNC style name (For example:\servername) or the IP address.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Title
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional, enter the title for this Dynamic Update Set. The default title is the server address.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SNMP Object ID
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the root OID for the object that returns the node IP addresses to be monitored.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SiteView Parent Group
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Select an existing SiteView group to which the above container group will be added as a subgroup. Choose SiteView Panel to create a new group on the SiteView Main Panel

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Pool Included
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Check this if the pool IP Address is included in the result of the oid walk (Note: for F5 servers).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Template Set
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Select the Monitor Set Template used to create new monitors.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Enable Operator Acknowledgement Functionality
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Choose this option to enable Operator Acknowledgement Functionality. This allows users to click on a monitor status icon and enter an acknowledgement text and time.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Alert Icons
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enables display of alert information for groups and monitors.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: IP Addresses Allowed Access
SvPreferenceAttr.description: The IP address that is always allowed access to SiteView. Use a trailing wildcard character to specify a range of IP addresses. For example, 206.168.191.* allows access to the 206.168.191 subnet. To allow multiple IP address, separate them by commas. To allow any IP address leave this field blank.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Backups To Keep
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the number of .mg files to keep as backups.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Require both IP address and Login
SvPreferenceAttr.description: This option limits access to connections that have both an allowed IP address and a correct username and password. When this option is turned off, it allows access to anyone who has either an allowed IP address or a valid username and password.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Create static HTML pages
SvPreferenceAttr.description: This option determines whether SiteView creates static HTML pages. Select this option if you access SiteView information using a separate web server application.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Password
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the default password to be used for authentication with remote systems.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Username
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the default username to be used for authentication with remote systems. Both "username" and "DOMAIN\username" are valid formats.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Blue gauges
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Check this option to enable the display blue gauges for monitors and groups.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SiteView Port
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the port number for the SiteView built-in web server. Leaving this blank will prevent SiteView from serving web pages.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: International Version
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enables SiteView to work with multiple character sets. When checked, all character encodings will be honored (for example, foreign language web pages). When unchecked, only the local system encoding is honored.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: License Number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the license number for this copy of SiteView. The license number is given to you when you purchase a license and is required after the 10 day evaluation period.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: License Number For X
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the license number for X for this copy of SiteView. The license number is given to you when you purchase X.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Locale-specific display of date and time
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Choose this option to enable the display of dates and times in a locale-specific manner. The default is the United States format.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Groups per Row
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the number of group names that you would like in each row on the main SiteView Screen.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Report Icons
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enables display of report information for groups and monitors.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Suspend Monitors
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Suspend all monitors. When checked, all monitors will be suspended. When unchecked, all monitors will start running according to their previous configuration.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Web Server Address
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the domain name or address of the web server serving the SiteView web pages (for example, demo.siteview.com). This option is used for providing links to SiteView management report pages in history summary e-mail.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Daily Logs To Keep
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the number of days of monitoring data to keep. Once a day, SiteView deletes any logs older than the specified number of days.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Maximum Size of Logs
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional, enter the maximum size, in bytes, allowed for all monitoring logs. Once a day, SiteView checks the total size of all monitoring logs and removes any old logs that are over the maximum size. If blank, the size is not checked.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Driver
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the driver used to connect to the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Password
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the password used to connect to the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Backup Database Connection URL
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional, enter the database URL to use if the main database connection is not available.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Connection URL
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the URL to the database connection (for example, if the ODBC connection is called SiteViewLog, the URL would be jdbc:odbc:SiteViewLog).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Database Username
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the username used to connect to the database.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Send Daily status messages
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Select if you would like to receive this regular status message.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Administrator E-mail Address:
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the administrator e-mail address where SiteView will send status messages. For example, sysadmin@this-company.com.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Send message whenever SiteView starts
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Select if you would like to receive this regular status message.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: From Email Address
SvPreferenceAttr.description: (optional) Enter the email address used as the From Address for SiteView messages. This is used to make it easier to browse or sort email generated by SiteView. For example, sysadmin@this-company.com.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Mail Server Domain Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the domain name of the mail server to use for sending messages. This server should be an SMTP mail server. For example, mail.this-company.com.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Backup Mail Server Domain Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: (optional) Enter the domain name of a backup mail server to use for sending messages when the primary mail server cannot be reached. This server should be an SMTP mail server. For example, mail.this-company.com.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disabled
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Disable the e-mail settings to prevent alert e-mail messages from being sent via that e-mail setting.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: E-mail To
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the e-mail addresses that alerts will be sent to when using the e-mail setting. Separate multiple addresses with commas (example: sysadmin@this-company.com, sales@this-company.com).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Id
SvPreferenceAttr.description: id associated with the mail preference

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Setting Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the name of the e-mail settings used to specify e-mail targets when adding alerts.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Schedule
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional schedule for these settings to be enabled - for example, enable Sunday from 10:00 to 22:00.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Template
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional template to use with this e-mail settings - if a template is selected, this template will be used for sending the alert to this e-mail setting.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Admin Password
SvPreferenceAttr.description: The login password for the SiteView administrator.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Dosable Login Page
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Set equal to true for disabling the new login page method (i.e., page not dialog).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: License
SvPreferenceAttr.description: a license number SiteView will shut down after the evaulation period

SvPreferenceAttr.label: _showTopazPage
SvPreferenceAttr.description: no description

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Web Server Address
SvPreferenceAttr.description: the web server address, default is "localhost". May be changed to IP or computer name

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Modem number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Contact your paging service to find out the Modem Number for your pager. This is also sometimes called the TAP/IXO number. (If you call this number, you should hear a modem answer it with a lovely screeching sound).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: PIN number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the last seven digits of your pager's PIN number.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Modem command
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use this option if your paging company does not use either of the two choices above. The modem command should contain the phone number to dial, any additional digits, followed by $message.SiteView replaces $message with the message specified for each Alert. where the message should be inserted. The comma character creates a short pause.For example, if the pager company's number is 123-4567, your pager PIN is 333-3333, and each command must be followed by the # key, the command might look like "ATDT 123-4567,,333-3333#,,$message#"

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Phone number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use this option if you use a direct phone number to send a page. Most local paging companies work like this.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: _pagerHangupCmd
SvPreferenceAttr.description: no description

SvPreferenceAttr.label: _pagerInitOptions
SvPreferenceAttr.description: no description

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Phone number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use this option if you have a direct number but need to enter a command before sending a page. Also, use this option if your paging company uses a single phone number for all pagers and requests a PIN number before sending a page.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Modem speed
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Most paging companies use 1200 baud - you only need to change the modem speed if your paging company requires it.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: _pagerTimeout
SvPreferenceAttr.description: no description

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Different methods for sending a message to your paging service.
SvPreferenceAttr.description: The Preferred method is to connect to a modem at your pager service. When a modem connection is used, SiteView is able to verify that the message was sent successfully. And, the messages can contain a description of the problem.The other options allow numeric messages to be sent using touch tone dialing. Touch tone dialing is limited to numeric messages. It also cannot confirm that your paging service correctly received the message.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disabled
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Disable the pager settings to prevent alert pages from being sent via that pager setting.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Setting Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the name of the pager settings used to specify pagers when adding alerts.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Modem number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Contact your paging service to find out the Modem Number for your pager. This is also sometimes called the TAP/IXO number. (If you call this number, you should hear a modem answer it with a lovely screeching sound).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: PIN number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the last seven digits of your pager's PIN number.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Modem command
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use this option if your paging company does not use either of the two choices above. The modem command should contain the phone number to dial, any additional digits, followed by $message.SiteView replaces $message with the message specified for each Alert. where the message should be inserted. The comma character creates a short pause.For example, if the pager company's number is 123-4567, your pager PIN is 333-3333, and each command must be followed by the # key, the command might look like "ATDT 123-4567,,333-3333#,,$message#"

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Phone number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use this option if you use a direct phone number to send a page. Most local paging companies work like this.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Phone number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use this option if you have a direct number but need to enter a command before sending a page. Also, use this option if your paging company uses a single phone number for all pagers and requests a PIN number before sending a page.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Modem speed
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Most paging companies use 1200 baud - you only need to change the modem speed if your paging company requires it.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Different methods for sending a message to your paging service.
SvPreferenceAttr.description: The Preferred method is to connect to a modem at your pager service. When a modem connection is used, SiteView is able to verify that the message was sent successfully. And, the messages can contain a description of the problem.The other options allow numeric messages to be sent using touch tone dialing. Touch tone dialing is limited to numeric messages. It also cannot confirm that your paging service correctly received the message.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Schedule
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional schedule for these settings to be enabled - for example, enable Sunday from 10:00 to 22:00.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Setting Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the name of the e-mail settings used to specify e-mail targets when adding alerts.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disable Connection Caching
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Check this box to disable caching of SSH connections

SvPreferenceAttr.label: NT Server Address
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the UNC style name (Ex: \FOO) or the IP address.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: _id
SvPreferenceAttr.description: no description

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Key File for SSH connections
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the path to the file containing the private key for this SSH connection. Only valid if authentication method is "Key File".

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Login
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the login for the remote server.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Connection Method
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Select the method used to connect to the remote server. Requires that applicable services be enabled on the remote machine.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Title
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional, enter the title for the remote server, the default title is the server address.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: _os
SvPreferenceAttr.description: no description

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Password
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the password for logging in to the remote server.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SSH Authentication Method
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Select the method to use to authenticate to the remote server (SSH connections only)

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SSH Connection Method
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Select the method to use to connect to the remote server.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Custom Commandline
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the command for execution of external ssh client. For substituion with above options use $host$, $user$ and $password$ respectivly. This setting is for only for connections using an external process.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Connection Limit
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the maximum number of connections allowed for this remote.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SSH Port Number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the port that the SSH service is running on.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: _status
SvPreferenceAttr.description: no description

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Trace
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Check this to trace messages to and from the remote NT server in the RunMonitor.log file.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SSH Version 2 Only
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Check this box to force SSH to only use SSH protocol version 2. ( This SSH option is only supported using the internal java libraries connection method)

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disable Connection Caching
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Check this box to disable caching of SSH connections

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Server Address
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the server address of the remote server (for example, demo.siteview.com). For HTTP connections, enter the URL of the CGI (for example, http://demo.siteview.com/cgi-bin/remote.sh).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: _id
SvPreferenceAttr.description: no description

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Initialize Shell Environment
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Shell commands to be executed at begining of session. Seperate by ';' for multiple commands.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Key File for SSH connections
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the path to the file containing the private key for this SSH connection. Only valid if authentication method is "Key File".

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Login
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the login for the remote server.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Login Prompt
SvPreferenceAttr.description: For Telnet and Rlogin connection types, enter the prompt output when the system is waiting for the login to be entered - the default is "ogin:"

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Connection Method
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the method used to connect to the remote server.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Title
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional, enter the title for the remote server, the default title is the server address.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: OS
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the OS on the remote server

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Password
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the password for logging in to the remote server.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Password Prompt
SvPreferenceAttr.description: For Telnet connection type, enter the prompt output when the system is waiting for the password to be entered - the default is "assword:"

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Prompt
SvPreferenceAttr.description: For Telnet and Rlogin connection types, enter the prompt output when the system is ready to handle a command - the default is #.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Secondary Prompt
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Secondary prompt. Separate by ',' for multiple prompts.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Secondary Response
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Response to the above prompt. Separate by ',' for multiple responses.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SSH Authentication Method
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Select the method to use to authenticate to the remote server (SSH connections only)

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SSH Connection Method
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Select the method to use to connect to the remote server.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Custom Commandline
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the command for execution of external ssh client. For substituion with above options use $host$, $user$ and $password$ respectivly. This setting is for only for connections using an external process.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Connection Limit
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the maximum number of connections allowed for this remote.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SSH Port Number
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the port that the SSH service is running on.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: _status
SvPreferenceAttr.description: no description

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Trace
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Check this to trace messages to and from the remote NT server in the RunMonitor.log file.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SSH Version 2 Only
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Check this box to force SSH to only use SSH protocol version 2. ( This SSH option is only supported using the internal java libraries connection method)

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Setting Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the name of the e-mail settings used to specify e-mail targets when adding alerts.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SNMP Community
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the SNMP community name used for this trap - usually this is "public".

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Trap ID: Generic
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the Generic trap type. If the generic trap type is "enterprise specific", then fill in the specific trap type which is a number.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Send to Host
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the host name or IP address of the machine that will receive this trap - for example snmp.this-company.com or 206.168.191.20. This is the machine running the SNMP console.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SNMP Object ID
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the SNMP object that is sending the trap. For example .1.3.6.1.2.1.1 is the "system" object from MIB-II (RFC 1213).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SNMP Trap version
SvPreferenceAttr.description: This describes what version the SNMP trap will be formatted in when sending to your SNMP host.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disabled
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Disable the SNMP settings to prevent alert traps from being sent via that SNMP setting.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Setting Name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the name of the SNMP settings used to specify SNMP settings when adding alerts.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SNMP Community
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the SNMP community name used for this trap - usually this is "public".

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Trap ID: Generic
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the Generic trap type. If the generic trap type is "enterprise specific", then fill in the specific trap type which is a number.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Send to Host
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the host name or IP address of the machine that will receive this trap - for example snmp.this-company.com or 206.168.191.20. This is the machine running the SNMP console.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SNMP Object ID
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the SNMP object that is sending the trap. For example .1.3.6.1.2.1.1 is the "system" object from MIB-II (RFC 1213).

SvPreferenceAttr.label: SNMP Trap version
SvPreferenceAttr.description: This describes what version the SNMP trap will be formatted in when sending to your SNMP host.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Create Adhoc Alert Reports
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Create adhoc alert reports

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disable Alerts
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Disable or enable alerts

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Edit Alerts
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Add, edit, or delete alerts

SvPreferenceAttr.label: View Alerts List
SvPreferenceAttr.description: View the list of the alerts in the alert page

SvPreferenceAttr.label: View Alert History Report
SvPreferenceAttr.description: View the recent history report for an alert

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disable Alerts Temporarily
SvPreferenceAttr.description: disable or enable alerts temporarily

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Test Alerts
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Test an alert

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Use the Browse Tool
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use the Browse Monitor form

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disabled
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Check to disable logins for this user

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Groups
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional, restrict access to the selected groups - the default allows access to all groups.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disable Groups
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Disable or enable groups

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Edit Groups
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Add, rename, copy, or delete groups

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Refresh Groups
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Refresh groups

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disable/Enable Application Health Monitors
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enable/Disable SiteView Health monitoring

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Edit Health Parameters
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Edit SiteView Health parameters

SvPreferenceAttr.label: View Health Page
SvPreferenceAttr.description: View the SiteView Health (self-monitoring) page

SvPreferenceAttr.label: LDAP service provider
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the LDAP server to connect to (example: ldap://ldap.this-company.com:389) for authentication.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Login name
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the login name for this user, if empty, no login name is required

SvPreferenceAttr.label: View Logs
SvPreferenceAttr.description: View the raw data for monitors, alerts and other logs

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Acknowledge Monitors
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Acknowledge monitors

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disable Monitors
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Disable or enable monitors

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Edit Monitors
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Add, edit, or delete monitors

SvPreferenceAttr.label: View Monitor History Report
SvPreferenceAttr.description: View the recent history report for a monitor

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Refresh Monitors
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Refresh monitors

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Use Monitor Tools
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use the Tools form for a monitor

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Edit Multi-view
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Add, edit or delete items on the Multi-View page

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Password
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Enter the login password for this user. if empty, no password is required. If using LDAP Authentication then this field is not used.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Edit Preferences
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use any of the Preference forms

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Test Preferences
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Test a preference setting

SvPreferenceAttr.label: View Progress
SvPreferenceAttr.description: View the Progress page showing monitors that are running

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Title
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Optional, enter the title for this user. The title will appear in the Name field of the User Preference table. The default title is the login name.

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Create Adhoc Reports
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Create adhoc reports

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Disable Reports
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Disable or enable reports

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Edit Reports
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Add, edit, or delete reports

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Generate Reports
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Generate a scheduled report manually

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Show Report Toolbar
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Include links at the top on reports

SvPreferenceAttr.label: LDAP Security Principal
SvPreferenceAttr.description: If using LDAP Authentication then this field is the Security Principal of the type " uid=testuser,ou=TEST,o=this-company.com".

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Use the Support Tool
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use the Send Support Request form

SvPreferenceAttr.label: Use Tools
SvPreferenceAttr.description: Use the generic Tools forms
